meanings.definition: The act of making something inactive or nonfunctional.
meanings.sent1: The deactivations of the old accounts were necessary to keep the system secure.
meanings.sent2: During the deactivations of the alarms, the building was vulnerable to intruders.
meanings.sent3: The deactivations of the robots in the movie led to chaos and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her deactivations of the negative thoughts transformed her outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The deactivations of the power grid plunged the city into darkness.

meanings.definition: The process of disabling or turning off a device or system.
meanings.sent1: The deactivations of the security cameras were part of the maintenance routine.
meanings.sent2: After the deactivations of the fire alarm, the silence was eerie.
meanings.sent3: The deactivations of the noisy machines brought peace to the factory floor.
meanings.sent4: His deactivations of the distractions allowed him to focus on his work.
meanings.sent5: The deactivations of the internet connection left them disconnected from the world.
